results.title: Mum How Do You Spell Gorbatrof?
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Film Australia and Pamela Williams
results.brief_description: A wonderful story that looks at the way one young Australian boy, Eamen Burke, pushes his capacity to speak up for himself in a world careering towards destruction. Eamen’s message is simple; “If people have the capacity to make bombs, then they should have the capacity to take them apart again - there’s so much beauty in the world that it would be a shame to spoil it”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Saunders, Film Australia and Pamela Williams

results.title: Mum and dad
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Patty Donaczy and ACMI
results.brief_description: Patty Donaczy’s parents got married in Cootamundra and made news. Despite being an interracial couple, they overlooked the prejudices of the time and embraced a future together. Their memory will live on in their children and grandchildren.

results.title: Mum's xmas
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and William Walker
results.brief_description: Christmas, 1970, and things look grim for Peter, Robert, Rita and Dad. As their expectant mother spells it out, a terminally ill grandparent, unemployed father, big eared grumpy guest and a present for two that has to be shared between three. Things are bound to go wrong, as they are astutely observed by eldest son, Robert. Cast includes Tina Owens, Michael and Jason Condon, Rodney Sharp and Tara Dixon.

results.title: Mum's the word
results.creator_credit: Rose Street Films, Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative and Carol Kostanich
results.brief_description: Looks at three single mothers living on social security benefits or pensions and how they maintain their family lives. These women raise fundamental questions about single parenthood and the Australian social security system.

results.title: Multiply and subdue the earth
results.creator_credit: Public Broadcasting Lab, WGBH Educational Foundation, Austin Hoyt and Ron Blau
results.brief_description: Man must use ecological planning and seek unity with nature, not conquest of it. Our cities are overcrowded, much of the air we breathe is polluted, and the source of our future supply of food and water is in danger. These problems are caused, in part, by unplanned use of our natural environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Public Broadcasting Lab, WGBH Educational Foundation, Austin Hoyt and Ron Blau

results.title: Multiplication (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
This program introduces the ‘sets of’, approach to multiplication and the meaning of the multiplication symbol is also considered. Children discussing a dressing-up situation with their teacher use Cartesian cross products to complete the work on multiplication

results.title: Multiple Xposure
results.brief_description:
Multiple Xposure is an interactive journey that explores the human mind through the use of film, dance, photography and soundscape. The CD Rom follows the life of a character named Stanley with Multiple Personality Disorder. As a photographer he is able to express himself through the images and with constant flashback to his abusive childhood affect his daily life immensely.

The idea is based on an individual’s perception when confronted with visual images. Our interpretation differs depending on our culture, personal background, experiences, personality, gender, psychological makeup, knowledge, interests, intentions and expectations. What a photographer captures on film depends on the above factors.

The body movement of dances fascinates the artist therefore he used this medium to provoke the audience’s state of mind and also soundscape was the inspiration of the series of photographic images.

results.title: Multiple man
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Forget, Clement Perron, Georges Dufaux and Claude Godbout
results.brief_description: A many-faced view of humanity, of global man in all his forms and interests. Produced originally in 70 mm (with stereophonic sound) for showing at Man and His World, the Montreal fair that succeeded Expo 67, this film employs the multi-image technique. People of all places, origins, cultures, secular and religious, are here united and seen side by side, creating an impressive, inspiring and challenging portrait. The film’s title appears in seven languages. Film without words. (Awards: six including Barcelona; Burenos Aires; Philadelphia)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Robert Forget, Clement Perron, Georges Dufaux and Claude Godbout

results.title: Multiple intelligences and Australian classrooms
results.creator_credit: Course Development Centre, Deakin University, Helen McGrath and Chris Perry
results.brief_description: Intelligence tests have traditionally concentrated in the narrow fields of language, mathematics and logic skill. This video provides snapshots of how teachers are using psychologist Howard Gardner’s model to improve their taching and recognise and assess particular strengths of each of their pupils. Gardner’s model suggests there are seven intelligences: Linguistic, Logical-mathematical, Visual-spatial, Musical, Bodily-Kinaesthetic, Interpersonal and Intrapersonal.
